The plant produces small, white to pink flowers that are typically clustered in umbels, and it has opposite, simple, ovate leaves. Spermacoce grandiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and thickets. Its fruit is a dry, three-lobed capsule that disperses seeds through wind and animal activity.
